sourceDesc.p: Created from original research by members of CWRC/CSÉC unless otherwise noted.

div.head: Tercera
div.p: This Ile is called Tercera, becauſe that of the Iles called Acores, it is the third
as the [ly] in order, to ſuch as come out of Spaine to ſail weſtward. It is
plentifull of corn and fruit, and not without wyne.
Madder which diers vſe for the dying of the cloth red; doth yield great comoditie
to the inhabitants of this Ile, for that it growth heere aboundantly.
.The Oxen of this Ile excede in fairneſſe [and] largeneſſe all others in Europe.
Ceder growth here in ſuch aboundance that it ferueth for fuel.
The chief towne of this Ile is called Angra which hath a [promontorie] where on
lieth a ſtrong forte called Brazil. The Spagniards do alſo call this Ile [Iſola del buen Teſu]. The ſhips coming from
the weſt Indies are accuſtomed heere to take harbor in their retourne to Spaine.
Of theſe Iles of Acores there are ſeauen in number, to wit Tercera, [S.Migbel,]
S.Marie, S. George, Gratioſa, Pico, and [Fayal] but the chiefeſt of name is Tercera.
